Comprei este jogo durante a promoção do natal e não me arrependo, não é tão frenético como L4D, mas é mais "shotter" porque podes fazer mira na arma coisa que não da no left 4 dead, o que torna o jogo não melhor, mas diferente, para quem gosta de apontar na mira e "sacar" um belo head, não ha nada melhor :)

Like many of you, I skipped this game thinking it was a grungier version of Left 4 Dead, oh my how late and wrong I was to play and skip this game. Rather than in L4D where you go from point A to point B, you and up to 5 of your buddies are dropped in an infected area somehere in Europe and are tasked with taking out as many Zeds as possible without dieing, and eventually taking out the big boss, the Patriarch, all while earning XP for one of seven perks. At the end of the day, the game is a VERY fun shooter and I would ask everyone to buy it the next time they have the oppurtunity.

This one snuck up on me. I bought it on sale figuring I'd play it once in a while at a LAN party or something. But once I started playing it hooked me pretty quick. There is something really satisfying about all the weapons, and upgrading your perks really adds to your combat effectiveness. Using iron sights is essential and firing "from the hip" with no on-screen aimpoint adds an additional challenge but when you get good at it you feel pretty badass. Teamplay is essential and I love that 6 people can play instead of just 2 or 4 like most co-op games. Gameplay is relatively simple (fight off waves of monsters with a boss at the end) but the levels are large and well designed. Strategy consists of finding a holdout spot with fallbacks (if possible) and channeling the zombies into your killzone. Public games actually work well too. This game is very different from Left 4 Dead 1&2 in a good way. I highly recommend.
Sick as fuck and a cheap zombie game

Very awesome game, Great with friends.

It's no Left4Dead, but then again, nothing is close to L4D. This game is very fun and the over-the-top gameplay is great. If you're just looking to kill some time (as well as other things... see what I did there...) then this game may be for you. If you can get it for $10-$15 then you might as well.

Killing floor sets you and your buddies against hordes of cloned, genetically modified monsters rampaging through England, and requires you to dispose of them in the usual manner.

There isn't really any story development; just a series of 'survival-style' challenges. What it does have, though, is character development. There are seven different classes ('perks') and in each round you can choose the perk that you use. It might make you more effective with a certain weapon, or faster, or give you discounts on equipment. The variety of equipment is very good; better that L4D2, say, with no 'dud' items.

Interestingly, playing as one class doesn't halt your progress against the other six. For example, a medic who fires a shotgun or lobs a grenade can advance their support and demolitions skills, respectively. Levelling up your character can be incredibly addictive!

The outdoor maps are very good, the approach to health is novel, and the characters' bleak humour is funny. Give it a try!

True iron sights, weapons class perks with set goals to progress to level 6 offering decreased recoil, increased damage and decreased weapon prices plus more. You start with 15 KG carry weight, so you can't stock up on more than a few weapons. With more players come more enemies. Each round gets progressively harder with tougher enemies in larger numbers. VOIP communication and filtered match searching. The graphics are gritty and dark with plenty of blood and bodies to be left behind. Shotgun support class with increased weight and grenade capacity+grenade damage. Medic class with its own MP7 Medic gun, alt fire to shoot a healing syringe into a friend at distance and improved armor. Firebug perk gains increased flamethrower and Mac10 damage with increndiary rounds while reducing incoming fire damage. Commando perk deals with automatics, Zed HP display and ability to spot invisible stalkers at a distance. 6 classes in all, plenty of maps and a large community.

If you're looking for a game in which you blash stuff, and there's a good amount of gore, this is the one for you.

This game is perfect when bought durring a sale. Simple gameplay just makes it feel like a Garry's Mod price of $10 or $15.

8/10

After a failed experiment at Horzine Biotech, people were turned to mutants-zombies, also known as zeds. The good observers will notice that the choppers keep crashing for reasons I'm not able to explain yet.

Your goal is to cooperate with your teammates during a defined number of waves in which each wave will hardener the difficulty until you get to the last wave, the one where you meet the infamous patriarch, your last zed.

This game supports single & multiplayer modes up to (from mind) 50 players, a real mess. It is well populated, you won't ever be alone.

Counter-Strike meets Left 4 Dead, minus the player versus player element. Purely about co-op survival.

Killing Floor is a game that relies a very great deal on team effort, though not necessarily team work. 

Players find themselves stranded in a variety of environments; including an underground laboratory, a hospital, a train station, a devestated city center and many others. They then attacked in waves by various types of zombies, or "zeds", with each wave becoming more and more intense. Each map offers many possible solutions a team can use to try to survive each wave, mainly through using choke points and welding shut entrances. Mainly, though, you will be relying on GUNS. 

The game has a good and fairly mature population, although the game itself is unforgiving on higher difficulties. I would recommend this game to people who like a huge arsenal when it comes to slaying zombies. 

It's been over 500 hours, and I still play this. I think we have a winner.

I really enjoy this game, but I wish the people playing it wasn't so lame.  Too bad my friends do not play it, because it sucks with a sucky team, but it is awesome with an awesome team.  Sometimes the mutiplayer games feel like I am playing single player with dumb AI, but I had some games with cool players that made me really enjoy the game.

A purely co-op survival "horror" game by Tripwire. The basis of the game is quite simple: you are the survivors of a zombie (or ZED) breakout, with the entirity of the United Kingdom having been overrun. Play as a survivor or a member of the military sent in to clean up the mess these things have made by the only way the military knows how: put them down. You need your team to win as, while on lower difficulties one can go rambo, the higher the difficulty and more players, the more one needs to stick together. And don't forget, it goes to 11!

Much like Valve's Left 4 Dead series, Killing Floor places you in the world of a survivor fighting against hordes of mindless killing machines bent on your demise. This, however is where those similarities end. There are more than 4 different "experiments" that are on the field, and you have different classes that you can choose from (akin to Team Fortress 2 class selection). You can progress through levels with each class, and as you do you unlock more benefits that are specific to each class.

Singleplayer play is decent enough, but online multiplayer is where Killing Floor truly shines. Given enough players with a decent skillset (or high enough class level), fighting against the hordes becomes an adrenaline-pumping, mic-screaming, over-the-top event that is the apex of any sort of survival-horror game played in a very long time.

Round up some friends, get your guns ready, and kick some ass.
Fun is the only word to describe it.

Really awesome, I'd say better than CoD Zombies.

Alrighty, time to update this review:
I've been playing this game for the majority of almost 3 years now, and I still enjoy playing it. For beginners, it has a lot of replayability value (since obtaining level six perks takes quite a while) which can take from 100-200 hours. After that, due to the Steam Workshop, there are a lot of options of playing with modded content. There are also dedicated custom servers with custom skins, perks, levels, weapons and more! (I recommend International Gaming Community btw ;) ) The gameplay isn't something to write home about, but there is something about that hooks you on. It's not as team intensive as L4D2, (as in, when there's only one person left, they're basically dead) but it does get close to that point. It's harder to understand the mechanics than L4D2 (since different weapons at different levels for different perks do different thigs to different enemies on different difficulties at different.. see what I'm getting at here?) BUT, once you get the hang of it, the game is tons of fun to play! Get a friend or two, (or three, or four, or five!) and get into a server and go spend hours and hours leveling up! :D

In conclusion, want to shoot zombies with your friends while having a level up game mechanic with different kinds of enemies and perks? Go buy this game! You won't regret it ESPECIALLY since it goes on sale all the time for as low as 5 dollars!
It's Left 4 Dead with perks and more awesome!

Y más modelos comprables(cagada)  para la personalización de nuestro avatar

После откровенного юмора в Team Fortress2, бешенных скачек в Left4Dead и нервной перезарядки в Battlefield 2 - KIlling Floor это конечно не МОНСТР. Но именно в этой игре вы по действительности оцените КРИКИ о помощи в поисках МЕДИКА. Еще ни в одной игре вы не найдете такой ненависти к СИРЕНАМ и "СОБАКАМ". Только тут вы почувствуете как будет сжиматься мышь под рукой в бешенном темпе стрельбы при виде Flash Paunda. По началу вас будут забавить уровни новичек и нормал и перейдя на суицид и Ад, вы оцените командный дух в ожидании 11 волны.

This a really. Really great game. Honestly you can play this for a very long while. With a good (not alot) variety of different classes, weapons, and player-made maps, Killing Floor is a real keeper. 

Pros:
- Satisfying variety of classes to choose from, none are permanent YOU-MUST-KEEP-THIS classes
- Satisfying variety of weapons
- Sort-of funny one-liners from the characters
- Alot of character skins, but only skins
- Large amount of maps to play on
- 5 Different difficulties
- Zed timer is unique, slow-motion, core, etc.

Cons:
- Only skins to buy
- Voice-chat is poor
- Limited monsters, only Fleshpound, Scrake, Husk, Siren, Bloat, Clot, Gorefast, Stalker, and Crawlers (9)
- If you don't like metal genre music or un-removable gradient, this isn't for you
- Zed timer can sometimes occur at bad times

Dosh!

That is all.

At first glance Killing Floor looks like a standard 1st person shooter.  You'll find a great many casual players who treat it as such.  However, Killing Floor is designed in such a way to allow intricate co-op play.  The various perks in the game allow a player to become more skilled using specific sets of weapons.  Each perk is designed to have specific functions within the game.  There are lots of games that claim to be co-op but Killing Floor demands that each player do their job and that overall you work with a team you can trust.  Get a team together and have fun!

Update: Even with the sequel out there is still something special and unique about KF1.
